Pre-Game Insights: Brazil is preparing to start their Copa America campaign against Costa Rica at the SoFi Stadium in Los Angeles.
Brazil's new permanent coach Dorival Junior comes into the Copa America with just four matches, all friendlies, behind him.
Dorival Junior is still searching for the right balance when it comes to tactics.
Brazil's pre-tournament performances this month against Mexico (3-2 win) and the U.S. (1-1) were less convincing.
Old timers such as Casemiro, Thiago Silva, and Neymar are absent from this squad, replaced by youngsters with less baggage.
Dorival Junior emphasized providing pleasure and happiness to the public and bringing back a sense of joy.
Current captain Danilo stated that the team's focus is on winning games, whether through attractive football or determination.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Rose Bowl in Pasadena is a significant site for Brazilian football, where Brazil sealed their fourth World Cup title in 1994.
Brazil aims to repeat their 1994 World Cup success as they prepare for the 2026 World Cup.
